lead_paragraph: The Chrysler Corporation said yesterday that California regulators had overturned proposed sanctions against the company over charges that it had violated California's ''lemon law.'' The penalty could have prevented the company from shipping vehicles to the state for a period of 45 days. Chrysler said it was pleased with the ruling, by the state's New Motor Vehicle Board, which came after the company appealed an earlier ruling by the California Department of Motor Vehicles.
abstract: Chrysler Corp says California regulators overturned proposed sanctions against company over charges that it violated California's 'lemon law'; penalty could have prevented company from shipping vehicles to the state for period of 45 days (S)
